page.title: 14FARMING AROUND NEW ROMNEY
page.content: I THINK ROMNEY MARSH IS A GREAT PLACE TO FARM IN BECAUSE IT HAS A RICH FERTILE SOIL.CROPS GROW WELL AND WE HAVE OUR OWN BREED OF SHEEP CALLED ROMNEYS AND THEY CAN STAND UP TO STRONG WINDS.THE REASON THAT THE SOIL IS RICH IS BECAUSE LONG AGO THE SEA BROUGHT IN SEDIMENT.ROMNEY MARSH WAS COVERED BY SEA BUT ISLANDS WERE FORMED,THEY ALL JOINED UP AND MADE THE RICH LAND WE HAVE.TURNIPS WERE GROWN FOR THEIR SEED.SEED STOMPING BOYS HELPED TO PLANT AND HARVEST THE SEED WHICH WAS BOUGHT BY ESTATES ON THE MARSH AND ASHFORD.THE BOYS STOMPED THE SEED OFF THE STALKS.IT WAS WORTH A LOT OF MONEY.THE ROMNEY SHEEP ARE THE MOST IMPORTANT.THEY ARE LARGE WHITE SHEEP.THE SHEPHERDS WERE CALLED LOOKERS THEY HAD HUTS BY THE FIELDS.
